recipe_name: Pine nut-crusted salmon with creamy mash, broccoli florets and a soft poached egg
author: Maria Elia
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. For the pine nut-crusted salmon, blend the breadcrumbs, garlic, pine nuts and butter in a food processor until smooth.  Season the salmon with salt and freshly ground black pepper, then press the breadcrumb mixture onto the flesh side of the fish. Bake in the oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through. (NB: The salmon is cooked through when the flesh is opaque.) For the creamy mash, boil the potato in salted water for 8-10 minutes or until the potato is tender. Mash the potato with the cream and butter until smooth. To serve, spoon the mash onto a plate. Place the salmon on top of the potato. Top with the poached egg and spoon the cooked broccoli florets alongside.
ingredients: 55g/2oz breadcrumbs,  1 garlic clove, peeled, crushed,  2 tbsp pine nuts,  25g/1oz butter,  100g/3½oz salmon fillet,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  ½ baking potato, peeled, chopped,  2 tbsp double cream,  25g/1oz butter,  1 soft poached egg,  3-4 cooked broccoli florets
